sen.j: 大和古墳群（おおやまとこふんぐん）は、奈良県天理市南部に所在する古墳群である。
sen.e: The Oyamata tumulus group is located in the southern part of Tenri City of Nara Prefecture
The Oyamata tumulus group is located in the southern part of Tenri City of Nara Prefecture
The Oyamata tumulus group is located in the southern part of Tenri City of Nara Prefecture

sen.j: 奈良盆地の東南の山麓に沿って、南から纏向古墳群、柳本古墳群、大和古墳群の三つの古墳群が、初瀬川右岸をおよそ南北に縦に並んで存在している。
sen.e: From the south, the three tumulus groups of the Makimuku tumulus group, the Yanagimoto tumulus group, and the Oyamato tumulus group are located along the southeastern foot of the Nara basin.
From the south, the three tumulus groups of the Makimuku tumulus group, the Yanagimoto tumulus group, and the Oyamato tumulus group are located along the southeastern foot of the Nara basin.
From the south, the three tumulus groups of the Makimuku tumulus group, the Yanagimoto tumulus group, and the Oyamato tumulus group are located along the southeastern foot of the Nara basin.

sen.j: 細分すると3つに分かれるが、一つの古墳集団として捉えることができる。
sen.e: Though classified into the three groups, they can also considered constituting a tumulus group.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Though classified into the three groups, they can also considered constituting a tumulus group.
Though classified into the three groups, they can also considered constituting a tumulus group.

sen.j: 更に、前方後円墳の最古級に属する箸墓古墳を含む纏向古墳群（箸中古墳群）を別にすれば、少し後からの築造と考えられている大和・柳本を合わせて大和・柳本古墳群とすることができる。
sen.e: Furthermore, excluding the Makimuku tumulus group (or also called Hashinaka tumulus group) that includes the Hashihaka tumulus, one of the oldest keyhole-shaped tumuli, the two groups of Oyamato and Yanagimoto, which are considered having been constructed later, can be integrated into the Oyamto/Yanagimoto tumulus group.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore, excluding the Makimuku tumulus group (or also called Hashinaka tumulus group) that includes the Hashihaka tumulus, one of the oldest keyhole-shaped tumuli, the two groups of Oyamato and Yanagimoto, which are considered having been constructed later, can be integrated into the Oyamto/Yanagimoto tumulus group.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペース削除しました、
sen.e: Furthermore, excluding the Makimuku tumulus group (or also called Hashinaka tumulus group) that includes the Hashihaka tumulus, one of the oldest keyhole-shaped tumuli, the two groups of Oyamato and Yanagimoto, which are considered having been constructed later, can be integrated into the Oyamto/Yanagimoto tumulus group.

sen.j: 王墓と推定される巨大古墳は、前期後半には奈良盆地の西北部へ移動している。
sen.e: The construction sites of huge tumuli, being presumed those of emperors, moved to the northwestern part of the Nara basin in the later era of the first half of the kofun period.
The construction sites of huge tumuli, being presumed those of emperors, moved to the northwestern part of the Nara basin in the later era of the first half of the kofun period.
The construction sites of huge tumuli, being presumed those of emperors, moved to the northwestern part of the Nara basin in the later era of the first half of the kofun period.

sen.j: 佐紀盾列古墳群である。
sen.e: It is the Sakitatenami tumulus group.
sen.cmt: この文章はウェッブでの原稿には無いようで、しかも唐突ですが、文字通りに訳してあります。
sen.e: It is the Sakitatenami tumulus group.
It is the Sakitatenami tumulus group.

sen.j: この古墳群を大和古墳群と呼ぶのは、古墳群の西辺に大和神社が鎮座することによる。
sen.e: The name of the Oyamato tumulus group originates in the fact that Oyamato-jinja Shrine is located on the western side of the tumulus group.
The name of the Oyamato tumulus group originates in the fact that Oyamato-jinja Shrine is located on the western side of the tumulus group.
The name of the Oyamato tumulus group originates in the fact that Oyamato-jinja Shrine is located on the western side of the tumulus group.

sen.j: 郡中には、前方後円墳12基、前方後方墳5基、円憤7基が知られている。
sen.e: This group includes 12 keyhole-shaped tumuli, five zenpo-koho (square front, square back) tumuli, and seven round tumuli.
sen.cmt: 郡： ”群”として訳してあります。
sen.e: This group includes 12 keyhole-shaped tumuli, five zenpo-koho (square front, square back) tumuli, and seven round tumuli.
This group includes 12 keyhole-shaped tumuli, five zenpo-koho (square front, square back) tumuli, and seven round tumuli.

sen.j: これらの古墳は、丘陵上の一群を中山支群、扇状地上の一群を萱生（かよう）支群とに分けることができる。
sen.e: These tumuli can be further classified into the Nakayama sub-group that consists of the tumuli on the hill and the Kayo sub-group that consists of the tumuli on the alluvial fan.
These tumuli can be further classified into the Nakayama sub-group that consists of the tumuli on the hill and the Kayo sub-group that consists of the tumuli on the alluvial fan.
These tumuli can be further classified into the Nakayama sub-group that consists of the tumuli on the hill and the Kayo sub-group that consists of the tumuli on the alluvial fan.

sen.j: 大和古墳群では古墳間に余り差がなく、主墳と陪墳という関係ではない。
sen.e: Since there is no much difference among the tumuli in the Oyamato group, no relationship between a main tumulus and its secondary tumulus exists among them.
Since there is no much difference among the tumuli in the Oyamato group, no relationship between a main tumulus and its secondary tumulus exists among them.
Since there is no much difference among the tumuli in the Oyamato group, no relationship between a main tumulus and its secondary tumulus exists among them.

sen.j: 南にある柳本古墳群は主墳と陪墳の傾向が強く、纏向古墳群は主墳と陪墳の関係で構成されている。
sen.e: In the Yanagimoto group in the south, the tumuli have a tendency of consisting of main tumuli and their subsidiary tumuli, and the Makimuku group consists of main tumuli and their subsidiary tumuli.
In the Yanagimoto group in the south, the tumuli have a tendency of consisting of main tumuli and their subsidiary tumuli, and the Makimuku group consists of main tumuli and their subsidiary tumuli.
In the Yanagimoto group in the south, the tumuli have a tendency of consisting of main tumuli and their subsidiary tumuli, and the Makimuku group consists of main tumuli and their subsidiary tumuli.

sen.j: 陪墳といっても強制の殉死をするわけではない。
sen.e: Here, a subsidiary tumulus does not mean that the person buried there was forced to die following the death of the person's master.
Here, a subsidiary tumulus does not mean that the person buried there was forced to die following the death of the person's master.
Here, a subsidiary tumulus does not mean that the person buried there was forced to die following the death of the person's master.

sen.j: 大和古墳郡中最大の前方後円である西殿塚古墳（にしとのづか、234メートル）は、柳本古墳群の行燈山古墳（現崇神天皇陵、241メートル）や渋谷向山古墳（現景行天皇陵、310メートル）に先行して築造された可能性がある。
sen.e: The 234-m Nishi-Tonozuka tumulus, the largest keyhole-shaped tumulus of the Oyamato group, may have been constructed earlier than the 241-m Andon-yama tumulus (the present mausoleum of Emperor Sujin) and 310-m Shibutani Mukoyama Tumulus (the present mausoleum of Emperor Keiko).

The Nishi-Tonozuka tumulus (234m), the largest keyhole-shaped tumulus of the Oyamato group, may have been constructed earlier than the Andonyama tumulus (the present mausoleum of Emperor Sujin, 241m) and Shibutani Mukoyama tumulus (the present mausoleum of Emperor Keiko, 310m).
sen.cmt: ハイフン削除しました。原文に合せて大きさの表記を括弧に入れました。tumulus小文字にしました。
sen.e: The Nishi-Tonozuka tumulus (234m), the largest keyhole-shaped tumulus of the Oyamato group, may have been constructed earlier than the Andonyama tumulus (the present mausoleum of Emperor Sujin, 241m) and Shibutani Mukoyama tumulus (the present mausoleum of Emperor Keiko, 310m).

sen.j: 西殿塚古墳は、宮内庁が管理しているために、国民はもちろん学者も自由に立ち入ることができない。
sen.e: Because the Nishi-Tonozuka tumulus is managed by The Imperial Household Agency, no scholar as well as ordinary persons can enter the tumulus site.
Because the Nishi-Tonozuka tumulus is managed by The Imperial Household Agency, no scholar as well as ordinary persons can enter the tumulus site.
Because the Nishi-Tonozuka tumulus is managed by The Imperial Household Agency, no scholar as well as ordinary persons can enter the tumulus site.

sen.j: 大和古墳群中最大で大王墓クラスとみられているのが先述の西殿塚古墳である。
sen.e: The Nishi-Tonozuka tumulus, the largest one of the Oyamato group described above, is considered being the tumulus of an Emperor-class person.
The Nishi-Tonozuka tumulus, the largest one of the Oyamato group described above, is considered being the tumulus of an Emperor-class person.
The Nishi-Tonozuka tumulus, the largest one of the Oyamato group described above, is considered being the tumulus of an Emperor-class person.

sen.j: またその近傍に175メートルに達する東殿塚古墳がある。
sen.e: The Higashi-Tonozuka tumulus as long as 175 m is located in the neighborhood
The Higashi-Tonozuka tumulus as long as 175m is located in the neighborhood.
sen.cmt: スペース削除しました。ピリオド補足しました。
sen.e: The Higashi-Tonozuka tumulus as long as 175m is located in the neighborhood.

sen.j: 他には100メートルから140メートル級の7基の前方後円墳や3基の前方後方墳がある。
sen.e: In addition, seven 100-m to 140-m keyhole-shaped tumuli and three zenpo-koho tumuli exist there as well.
In addition, seven 100m to 140m keyhole-shaped tumuli and three zenpo-koho tumuli exist there as well.
sen.cmt: ハイフン削除しました。
sen.e: In addition, seven 100m to 140m keyhole-shaped tumuli and three zenpo-koho tumuli exist there as well.

sen.j: 1986年に吉備的な特殊器台の破片の発見によって、古墳発生期まで遡る可能性の指摘された中山大塚古墳（120メートル、県史跡）がある。
sen.e: This group also includes the 120-m Nakayama Otsuka tumulus (designated as a historical site by the prefecture), where broken pieces of a tokushu-kidai (ceremonial vessel stand) specific to the Kibi area were found in 1986, and based on the discovery, it was pointed out that the tumulus may have been constructed in the era when kofun tumuli started being constructed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This group also includes the 120m Nakayama Otsuka tumulus (designated as a historical site by the prefecture), where broken pieces of a tokushu-kidai (ceremonial vessel stand) specific to the Kibi area were found in 1986, and based on the discovery, it was pointed out that the tumulus may have been constructed in the era when kofun tumuli started being constructed.
sen.cmt: ハイフン削除しました。
sen.e: This group also includes the 120m Nakayama Otsuka tumulus (designated as a historical site by the prefecture), where broken pieces of a tokushu-kidai (ceremonial vessel stand) specific to the Kibi area were found in 1986, and based on the discovery, it was pointed out that the tumulus may have been constructed in the era when kofun tumuli started being constructed.

sen.j: 更に、1993年には後円部に竪穴式石室の存在が分かった。
sen.e: In addition, it was found in 1993 that a vertical style stone chamber existed in the round part of this tumulus.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, it was found in 1993 that a vertical style stone chamber existed in the round part of this tumulus.
In addition, it was found in 1993 that a vertical style stone chamber existed in the round part of this tumulus.

sen.j: この石室には輝石安山岩（サヌカイト）と推定される板石が主として使われている。
sen.e: Stone plates supposed to be pyroxene andesite (sanukite) are mainly used for this stone chamber.
Stone plates supposed to be pyroxene andesite (sanukite) are mainly used for this stone chamber.
Stone plates supposed to be pyroxene andesite (sanukite) are mainly used for this stone chamber.

sen.j: また下池山古墳も県の史跡に指定されている。
sen.e: The Shimoikeyama tumulus there is also designated as a historical site by the prefecture.
The Shimoikeyama tumulus there is also designated as a historical site by the prefecture.
The Shimoikeyama tumulus there is also designated as a historical site by the prefecture.
